results.title: News digest [No. 2]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Crop-dusting aircraft help growers produce cotton near Robinvale; Dhurringile, a castle near Shepparton, is home to Scottish orphans who learn its history and help on the farm; the “Tambo Lady”, a 65-foot motor cruiser has a test run along the Latrobe River to Sale; young artists’ work displayed at the Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: News digest [No. 14]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “News digest”.
Magazine items: 14-day commando course in cliff-climbing and descents for a C.M.F. company; “Frostbite regatta” - hardy all year yachtsmen race in eight-foot sabots on Waranga Reservoir in Northern Victoria; “Four in one” - a Carlton Methodist church where the service may be followed in Spanish, Italian, Hungarian and English, thus assisting migrants’ integration; “Whirlybird weapon” - helicopters used to spray crops in the Mallee prove their reliability; “Bouncing Babies” - veteran cars prove their reliability during a lively car trial.

results.title: News digest [No. 13]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Money makers produce decimal coins at Bendigo; Mt. Scurvy will disappear if quarrying continues by 1984; Tuna - a new catch in new nets off the Gippsland Lakes worth 8,000 pounds per annum; two kinds of art - Eskimos stone carvings and needlework; Erwen Ponds clear spring water attracts divers and grows huge water lilies.

results.title: News digest [No. 12]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Horses and hounds “meet” at Oaklands Hunt Club for fiftieth year; model steam engines run on backyard tracks; Melbourne’s model boat club members control hand-made miniatures by radio; gliders of the Wimmera Soaring Club soar up to 1,100 feet; for the film fan variety is provided by the Echuca Regional Library; Austrian instructors and modern lodges attract many skiers to Falls Creek.

results.title: News digest [No. 11]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Grand parade of steam engines at Echuca veterans rally; instant home on trailer converts into caravan in 3 minutes; Officer cadets from many countries train together at Portsea; walkie-talkie helps annual round-up of cattle in Baama forest; unusual garden hobby of Mildura resident is collecting spiders.

results.title: News digest [No. 10]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: “Look no waves” - ‘surfing’ on skates at Sandringham. “White Harvest” - of 25,000 tons of salt from Lake Tyrrell. “Imitation realist” - exhibition of assemblages by Colin Lanceley, includes “Shoot the Piano Player” and “Reliquary”. Samoyeds’ hair spun with wool and knitted. “Jumping jacks”- at the Victorian Trampolining Championships showing grace and skill.

results.title: News digest [No. 1]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Aerial fire fighters spraying a thin jelly, provide a valuable addition to orthodox methods; underwater divers hunt seals with a camera and shoot them on film; demolition of St. Peter’s church at Eaglehawk; wheelwright at Bridgwater shows his craftsmanship, repairing an iron wheel.

results.title: News
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Mike Wooller and Tim King
results.brief_description: Shows how the news is gathered and presented on the 9 o’clock news on BBC1, including the build-up of tension among the team when making time and location checks. Great “bird’s-eye” view of the news team.

results.title: Newfoundland scene: a tale of outport adventure (D)
results.brief_description: NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF THE SLAUGHTER OF BABY SEALS. A study of Newfoundland’s natural resources and primary industry. Cod fishing, sealing and whaling are the focus of this documentary. Also looked at is transportation by Eskimo sled. Includes scenes of Labrador Retrievers, a malemute dog sled team mutinying against its leader causing injfires, the light from a lighthouse and a Newfoundland outport wharf in the misty dawn. (Awards: Canadian Film Award, 1951)

results.title: Newborn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Heather Cook
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Examines the various inborn abilities, reflexes and working senses of newborn babies. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
